current-chamber.#text: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

official-title.#text:
Recognizing Easy Company, 2nd Battalion of the 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment of the 101st
			 Airborne Division.

cosponsor.#tail: ) submitted the following resolution; which was referred to the

text.#text: the impact of Easy Company and the bravery of all of the heroes who have served in the company; and
the brave Pennsylvania natives who served in Easy Company.

Whereas Easy Company, 2nd Battalion comprised part of the 506th Parachute Infantry Regiment of the
			 101st Airborne Division of the
Whereas Easy Company was immortalized by the heroic actions of its soldiers during World War II;

quote.#tail: , introduces a new generation of people of the United States to the valorous deeds of Easy Company;

text.#text:
Whereas Easy Company engaged in critical combat missions during World War II, including the Battle
			 of Normandy, Operation
			 Market Garden, the Battle of Bastogne, and the Allied capture of Hitler's
			 Eagles Nest;

Whereas Easy Company was originally comprised of 140 soldiers, 12 of whom were natives of the State
			 of Pennsylvania;

quote.#tail:
Winters, Thomas Meehan III, Harry F. Welsh, Jack Edward Foley, Joseph D. Toye, William J.
			 Guarnere, Forrest L. Guth, Edward James Heffron, Albert Blithe, Carl L.
			 Fenstermaker, Roderick G. Strohl, and Joseph
			 A. Lesniewski;

text.#text: Whereas the Pennsylvania heroes who helped to form Easy Company were Richard D.

Whereas Easy Company lost 49 soldiers, including Thomas Meehan III, who paid the ultimate price for
			 freedom during World War II; and

quote.#tail:
, on March 8, 2014, all
			 of the Pennsylvania natives who served in  Easy Company, except for
			 Roderick G. Strohl, have passed away:
			 Now, therefore, be it

text.#text: Whereas with the passing of William J. Guarnere, also known as
